00033 #include "../common/common.h"
00034 #include "../common/ipc.h"
00035 #include "../common/poptmx.h"
00036 
00037 #define _USE_MATH_DEFINES // for M_PI
00038 
00039 using namespace std;
00040 
00041 
00043 struct clargs {
00044   Path command;               
00045   Path z0_name;                 
00046   Path zD_name;                 
00047   Path phs_name;                
00048   Path abs_name;                
00049   float dd;                     
00050   float alpha;                  
00051   float lambda;                 
00052   float dist;                   
00053   float dgamma;                 
00054   bool SaveInt;                         
00055   bool beverbose;             
00056 
00058   clargs(int argc, char *argv[]);
00059 };
00060 
00061 
00062 clargs::clargs(int argc, char *argv[]) :
00063   z0_name(""),
00064   dd(1.0),
00065   alpha(0.0),
00066   lambda(1.0),
00067   dgamma(1.0),
00068   SaveInt(false),
00069   beverbose(false)
00070 {
00071 
00072 
00073   poptmx::OptionTable table
00074         ("IPC contrast processing",
00075      "Extracts the phase and/or absorption contrast from the input image(s)."
00076      " Depending on the input parameters utilizes BA, MBA or BAC algorithms.");
00077 
00078   table
00079         .add(poptmx::NOTE, "ARGUMENTS:")
00080         .add(poptmx::ARGUMENT, &zD_name, "far-intensity", "Contrast taken at the distance.", "")
00081         .add(poptmx::ARGUMENT, &z0_name, "0-intensity", "Contrast taken in the contact print plane"
00082          " (clean absorption contrast).", "", "<NONE>")
00083 
00084     .add(poptmx::NOTE, "OPTIONS:")
00085         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &phs_name, 'p', "phase", "Image name to output the phase component", "", "<NONE>")
00086         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &abs_name, 'a', "absorption",
00087          "Image name to output the absorption component", "", "<NONE>")
00088         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &dist, 'z', "distance", "Object-to-detector distance (mm)",
00089          "More correctly the distance from the contact print plane and the detector plane where the image"
00090          " given by the argument " + table.desc(&zD_name) + " was taken. " + NeedForQuant)
00091         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &dd, 'r', "resolution", "Pixel size of the detector (micron)",
00092          NeedForQuant, toString(dd))
00093         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &alpha, 'l', "alpha", "The alpha-parameter of the MBA.", "", toString(alpha))
00094     .add(poptmx::OPTION, &lambda, 'w', "wavelength", "Wavelength of the X-Ray (Angstrom)",
00095          "Only needed together with " + table.desc(&alpha) + ".", toString(lambda))
00096         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &dgamma, 'g', "gamma", "Gamma coefficient of the BAC.",
00097          "Must be a value around 1.0 (theoretical).", toString(dgamma))
00098         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &SaveInt,'i', "int",
00099          "Output image(s) as integer.", IntOptionDesc)
00100         .add_standard_options(&beverbose)
00101         .add(poptmx::MAN, "SEE ALSO:", SeeAlsoList);
00102 
00103   if ( ! table.parse(argc,argv) )
00104         exit(0);
00105   if ( ! table.count() ) {
00106         table.usage();
00107         exit(0);
00108   }
00109   command = table.name();
00110 
00111 
00112   if ( ! table.count(&zD_name) )
00113         exit_on_error(command, "Missing required argument: "+table.desc(&zD_name)+".");
00114 
00115   if ( ! table.count(&phs_name) && ! table.count(&abs_name) )
00116         exit_on_error(command, "At least one of the two following arguments is required: "
00117                   +table.desc(&phs_name)+ ", " +table.desc(&phs_name)+ ".");
00118 
00119   if ( ! table.count(&dist) )
00120         exit_on_error(command, "Missing required option: "+table.desc(&dist)+".");
00121   if (dist <= 0.0)
00122         exit_on_error(command, "Zero or negative distance (given by "+table.desc(&dist)+").");
00123   dist /= 1.0E3; // convert mm -> m
00124 
00125   if (dd <= 0.0)
00126         exit_on_error(command, "Zero or negative pixel size (given by "+table.desc(&dd)+").");
00127   dd /= 1.0E6; // convert micron -> m
00128 
00129   if ( abs(dgamma)>=1.0 ) // should set even smaller limit
00130         exit_on_error(command, "Absolute value of gamma (given by "+table.desc(&dgamma)+")"
00131                   " is greater than 1.0.");
00132 
00133   if (lambda <= 0.0)
00134         exit_on_error(command, "Zero or negative wavelength (given by "+table.desc(&lambda)+").");
00135   if ( table.count(&lambda) && ! table.count(&alpha) )
00136     warn(command, "The wavelength (given by "+table.desc(&lambda)+") has influence only together"
00137          " with the alpha parameter (given by "+table.desc(&alpha)+").");
00138   if ( ! table.count(&lambda) && table.count(&alpha) )
00139     warn(command, "The wavelength (given by "+table.desc(&lambda)+") needed together with"
00140          " the alpha parameter (given by "+table.desc(&alpha)+") for the correct results.");
00141   lambda /= 1.0E10; // convert A -> m
00142 
00143   if (alpha < 0.0)
00144         exit_on_error(command, "Negative alpha parameter (given by "+table.desc(&alpha)+").");
00145 
00146 }
00147 
00148 
00149 
00150 
00152 int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
00153 
00154   const clargs args(argc, argv) ;
00155 
00156   Map id;
00157   ReadImage(args.zD_name, id);
00158   Shape sh=id.shape();
00159   Map out(sh);
00160   IPCprocess proc(sh, args.alpha, args.dist, args.dd, args.lambda);
00161 
00162   if ( ! args.z0_name.empty() ) {
00163     if (args.alpha != 0.0)
00164       warn (args.command, "Both the contrast in the contact print plane (pure absorption) and"
00165             " \\alpha parameter of the MBA are given: two overlapping methods to correct the"
00166             " absorption.");
00167     Map i0;
00168     ReadImage(args.z0_name, i0);
00169     id /= unzero(i0);
00170   }
00171 
00172   if( ! args.phs_name.empty() ) { // MBA
00173     proc.extract(id, out, IPCprocess::PHS);
00174     SaveImage(args.phs_name, out, args.SaveInt);
00175   }
00176   if( ! args.abs_name.empty() ) { // BAC
00177     if (args.alpha == 0.0)
00178       warn (args.command, "The \\alpha parameter of the BAC is zero."
00179             " Always produces (almost) flat absorption.");
00180     proc.extract (id, out, IPCprocess::ABS, args.dgamma);
00181     SaveImage (args.abs_name, out, args.SaveInt);
00182   }
00183   
00184   exit(0);
00185 
00186 }
